publications.title: Developmental Trend of Subjective Well-Being of Weibo Users during COVID-19
publications.subtitle: Frontiers in Psychology
publications.description: This study selects the Sina Weibo platform, which is highly popular in China and analyzes the subjective well-being (SWB) of Weibo users during the COVID-19 pandemic in combination with the machine learning classification algorithm. By analyzing and modeling texts sent through this platform, we comprehensively reveal the characteristics of the dynamic psychological state and living conditions of social media users during the pandemic.

name: Rebecca Buss
position: Economics & Physics @ UC Berkeley
about:
I grew up in California but English was not my first language as I have immigrant parents from Germany. We moved to my dad’s hometown in 6th grade to care for my grandmother.

That experience felt like a big adventure and so different from my protected life in California. I used public transport and rode my bike everywhere, hung out with friends and joined a swim team, had weekend dinners with my grandmother and babysat my cousins.

From the year spent in Germany, I gained so much: life-long friends–whom I still visit every summer–language skills, German culture, but most importantly, I learned to be open to change. It turned out to be one of the best years of my life. I entered the German school unsure, scared for what was to come. I left realizing that I can tackle any challenge and that being open to change and new ideas makes me happy.
Subsequently, I tried out lots of new things, from becoming a soccer referee for competitive club games (which was fun except for the yelling parents) to volunteering at the animal shelter (I love dogs!!) to tutoring English learners in my high school (they shared amazing life experiences).

Now that I am in college, in a much larger and more diverse environment, I am surrounded by so many different people with various backgrounds every day, whether they are from my hometown or halfway across the world. I love learning about their experiences and building new relationships.

          The Students In Action Club at my High School was part of the overarching Multiplying Good Bay Area Organization. At school, in weekly meetings, we organized events, such as fundraisers, to support causes that help vulnerable communities and Multiplying Good organizations. As a junior, I was promoted to President of the Club and then Senior Advisor in my senior year. I also attended and spoke at biannual Multiplying Good conferences for other Students In Action Teams in the Bay Area. At the beginning of 2023, I was chosen to be the Student Speaker for the annual Jefferson Awards VIP Reception, and I spoke on my experience in Students In Action in front of the CEO and other higher-ups at the KPIX studio in San Francisco.

recommendations: Charesse Spiller “Candice is personable, highly adaptable, and a motivated, up and coming professional. As the founder of a growing firm, I was looking to start working with interns who could easily plug-in to the company in a remote capacity. Candice's spring internship was focused on SOP development and selecting the best technology tool to support our processes and team structure. Candice did an exceptional job at comparing the best options for the SOP software, refining our existing processes, and creating new SOPs for our future consultants. As a result of Candice's time at Level Best, we now have our SOPs documented for our main service offerings, we are onboarding new team members seamlessly, and have a go forward action plan with how to maintain the work that Candice started. I am so grateful for Candice's contribution to the success of Level Best and I believe she would be an asset to any company she chooses to work with.”

organizations.description: Delta Sigma Pi is a professional fraternity organized to foster the study of business in universities; to encourage scholarship, social activity and the association of students for their mutual advancement by research and practice; to promote closer affiliation between the commercial world and students of commerce, and to further a higher standard of commercial ethics and culture and the civic and commercial welfare of the community.

organizations.title: Capital Investments at Berkeley
organizations.description: Capital Investments at Berkeley is a student-run hedge fund that seeks to deliver long-term and consistent absolute returns. Meanwhile, the organization also aim to educate UC Berkeley students on necessary skills for trading alternative investment products. Through the organization's fund, students will gain first-hand experience in exploring and executing various trading strategies.

name: Horace Chi-hong Ho
position: COO @SIAI | PE Analyst @Chifortune Venture | Managing Partner @FEDS | CEO @IvyWins | UC Berkeley
about:
I am an Associate of Operation at Undergraduate Private Equity Club at Berkeley, where I assist in planning and organizing events, managing the budget, and promoting the club to potential members and sponsors. I am also a co-founder and CEO of IvyWins College Consultation, a company that provides admission counseling services to high school students applying to colleges, using advanced AI and machine learning algorithms for data-driven insights. I am pursuing my Bachelor of Engineering degree in Industrial Engineering and Operations Research at the University of California, Berkeley, with an expected graduation date of May 2025.

In my role as a co-founder and CEO of IvyWins, I have established a culture and vision for the company, leveraged data to spotlight students' strengths and address areas for growth, and successfully internationalized IvyWins, expanding its impact beyond borders. I have also gathered about 100 students for all services, fostering a community of learners and achievers. Additionally, I have previous experience in sales at Vector Marketing, where I executed on outbound calling strategies, organized meetings and appointments with potential customers, and developed customer relationships. I have skills in management, operations management, and operating systems, which I apply to both my academic and professional endeavors. I am passionate about empowering aspiring private equity professionals and high school students with AI and data, and I would love to bring my diverse perspectives and experiences to your team.

experience.title: Private Equity Analyst
experience.description: •	Spearheaded the sourcing and evaluation of 30+ growth stage investment opportunities across high-growth verticals including biomedical, EV components, semiconductor, and generative AI sectors. Strategically identified prospects that aligned with the firm’s $800M fund mandate, ensuring that each potential deal exhibited high growth potential and scalable business models.•	Conducted robust financial due diligence and valuation analysis on 5+ high-value investment targets, utilizing advanced LBO, and Multiples to generate financial projections and stress-test assumptions. Presented findings to senior partners, contributing to the projected IRR of 36%.•	Led the creation of a valuation model for a $5M Series A strategic partnership focused on sustainability, which resulted in an immediate 2x increase in market share for the portfolio company within 3 months, directly supporting the firm’s $100M sustainability-focused portfolio.

projects.title: Unlocking Insights from the Shadows: A Machine Learning Approach to Analyze COVID-19 Patient Data in Mexico
projects.description: • Regression analysis, CART algorithm, Random Forests, and Neural Networks to identify key COVID-19 mortality predictors.• Cross-validation and regularization techniques to optimize model performance and prevent overfitting, ensuring model generalizability and robustness.• Identified significant COVID-19 mortality predictors to inform effective patient care decisions and targeted public health interventions.• Led the project from conception to completion, including report writing, presentations, and project management, ensuring successful delivery within deadlines and budget.• Collaborated effectively with a cross-functional team of students in different background.• Presented findings and drafted results in a working paper.• Developed and implemented data visualization tools to communicate complex findings to diverse audiences.

recommendations: Eddie Lin “I first met Elisa when she was selected for the Citi Ventures CUPID program. After working with her on Citi projects, she could easily have been my colleague at UBS Investment Bank or Goldman Sachs. What impressed me most was her natural intellectual curiosity and spirit of continuous improvement. She always delivered more than what she was asked every single week, and did so with great joy and enthusiasm. She also has a great spirit of entrepreneurship, without being asked she took the initiative in learning how to model her own CDO as part of a strategy to help underbanked Americans. The mindfulness of social impact while helping grow business leveraging the core revenue model of a commercial and investment bank is a thought process well beyond her years. I do not take for granted she was always early to every meeting, and everyone is always happy to work with her as she has a great positive energy and attitude. She did a fantastic job leading her team to a level of execution that impressed all. She is a natural presenter and followed best practices often not seen into those until well into their careers.”

Ryan Zervakos “I would like to recommend Elisa for leadership in the LinkedIn Student Learning Champion program. As one of the LinkedIn leads for this program, I have become acquainted with Elisa in her various and wide-ranging roles and contributions across the campus of Irvine Valley College. Elisa not only exceeded my expectations of her, but she has been continually innovating and collaborating with students from across the world. In addition to her full-time load at school, Elisa explored the suite of tools offered by LinkedIn and as needed, took courses on LinkedIn Learning to further develop soft skills. One of the key components of this program is sharing experiences and stories of learning achievement and career readiness. Elisa engaged in several initiatives aimed at bringing awareness to and engagement with LinkedIn Learning. However, Elisa steered away from merely completing the required tasks and instead challenged herself to create, plan and implement a powerful online presence. Elisa initiated conversations through posts and articles on the LinkedIn feed as well as pursued a series of campaigns that ranged from face-to-face public speaking events for clubs and campus events to online video campaigns that told the both the personal and professional journey of attending a higher education institution in pursuit of career goals. One example of her dedication is how she collaborated with several other LiL Champions to create a podcast on Spotify spreading the message to any student on the value of both LinkedIn and LinkedIn Learning. As a member of this program, Elisa was a dedicated and excellent contributor. As a participant, she was a diligent, intelligent, committed person who, in every instance, went beyond the minimum requirements of whatever she was asked to do – even helping others along the way. She has excellent management skills, compassionately interacts with students, team members and managers in a professional and friendly manner. She is a self- starter, a problem-solver, a team player, a good communicator, and a fair and reasonable person when difficult choices present themselves. She isn’t afraid to seek answers to difficult questions and is ready to apply critical problem-solving skills to any situation—technical, professional, or academic. I am very enthusiastic when it comes to Elisa. She is a passionate person, a professional, and a voice of caring and humor in a constantly changing world. That perfect blend of humanity and strategic problem-solving skills is a requirement for any role today, and its these qualities that will inevitably lead to remarkable opportunities for Elisa to serve others. ”

publications.title: Fall 2021: Students Finalists Selected for Fall Cohort of the Citi University Partnerships in Innovation & Discovery Program
publications.subtitle: California Community Colleges

publications.title: Spring 2021: Students Finalists Selected for Citi University Partnerships in Innovation & Discovery Program
publications.subtitle: California Community Colleges
publications.description: CITI® Ventures is collaborating with California Community Colleges and NexusEdge Education to connect students with real-world, real-time capstone projects through the Citi University Partnerships in Innovation & Discovery (CUPID) program. Under the CUPID Program, CitiBank/Citi Ventures is looking to develop a pipeline of California community college students from which to recruit for employment. The “Capstone to Career” project through CUPID allows students to test the waters in a real-world, experiential format and is more simplified than a formal internship process.The program offers a series of digital badges with subjects ranging from bitcoin to blockchain, smart cities to securities, personal finance, capital markets, and others. The digital badges can be assigned as class assignment, course complement, extra project, or as a group club/organizational challenge. To qualify for the interview phase of CUPID, students had to pass 3 Citi exams, complete 3 essays, and forward their resume. Many students across California completed all 3 Citi exams for consideration into the Citi CUPID Capstone program as part of their courses. Students were selected based on writing samples simulating on-the-job responsibilities.As part of the process, a California Community College Student Event was also held on interview tips & career opportunities. Hundreds of California Community College students signed-up to hear directly from Citi senior leadership on the opportunities and day-to-day responsibilities at the world’s largest global financial services institution. Students received interview tips on how to secure careers at the firm.

name: Larry Guo
position:
Green Capital Navigator / Strategic Visionary / Financial Storyteller
Environmental Economics and Policy major (BS) at UC Berkeley 
Berkeley Investment Group, Undergraduate Real Estate Club Member
about:
Class of 2026 at UC Berkeley, pursuing a B.S. in Environmental Economics and Policy with a focus on sustainability, financial markets, and investment strategies. My academic journey has been enriched by study experiences at Harvard and the University of Chicago, building a solid foundation in finance and environmental policy.

My professional experience spans private equity, investment banking, and strategic consulting. As a Private Equity Intern at Caprae Capital Partners, I contributed to acquisition strategies and conducted market research to support growth initiatives. During my Investment Banking Summer Internship at Huatai United Securities, I gained experience in IPO processes and compliance frameworks. At Deloitte Consulting, I honed my skills in strategic risk advisory by analyzing dealership networks for a leading automobile company.

Driven by a commitment to sustainability, I co-founded Carbon Trail Assess and Carbon Era—two ventures focused on carbon footprint management and carbon asset trading. Carbon Trail Assess provides SMEs with strategic carbon solutions, while Carbon Era is a comprehensive carbon trading platform, serving over 2,200 controlled-emission enterprises in China. Both ventures leverage data analytics to simplify carbon trading and help businesses achieve sustainable growth.

In 2024, I joined both the World Economic Forum’s 1t.org Youth Hub as one of four representatives from China and the UNDP INSPIRO Young Entrepreneurs Network for SDGs. These global communities allow me to collaborate with youth leaders on ecosystem restoration, biodiversity conservation, and sustainable development, advocating for transformative, youth-led solutions on platforms like the Davos Forum.

Currently, I’m expanding my financial knowledge through the Berkeley Investment Group’s Fundamentals of Investing Decal, where I’m learning valuation models and investment strategies to prepare for future roles in finance and sustainability.

I’m passionate about merging finance with environmental solutions. Let’s connect if you’re interested in discussing innovative projects in finance, sustainability, or environmental policy.

experience.description: Mint Capital | Equity Research Team | March 2025 – Present· Conduct bottom-up fundamental research across public equities to support alpha-generating investment theses, covering sectors such as consumer services and energy.· Completed stock research reports on H&R Block (NYSE: HRB) and Cenovus Energy (TSE: CVE), including full valuation models, competitive positioning analysis, and assessment of key business drivers.· Build multi-scenario financial models (Bull, Base, Bear) to evaluate earnings sensitivity, risk-reward asymmetry, and target price range under different growth and margin assumptions.· Identify and assess key drivers of company performance, incorporating macroeconomic trends, regulatory shifts, and strategic inflection points.· Conduct valuation using DCF and multiples-based approaches; benchmark results against street consensus and historical valuation ranges.· Monitor and document key risks, including policy shifts (e.g. tariffs, climate regulations), market dislocation factors, and idiosyncratic operational risks.· Extract and process data from Bloomberg, FactSet, and Capital IQ to support model building, sentiment checks, and peer analysis.· Collaborate with senior analysts on thematic research, particularly integrating ESG considerations into traditional financial frameworks.· Present findings in investment memos and internal pitch meetings, synthesizing complex data into clear, actionable insights for PMs.

publications.subtitle: Advances in Economics Management and Political Sciences
publications.description: After completing our market research report on Harvard's shared power bank initiative, I played a key role in organizing our team to author a paper published in prestigious academic journals across the United Kingdom. This paper delves into the significant role shared power banks play in transforming North American tourism. It offers an in-depth analysis of both the economic and cultural impacts brought about by the adoption of shared power banks. Our team's paper has been cited by news and academic research several times.December 2023 Advances in Economics Management and Political Sciences 52(1):292-302DOI:10.54254/2754-1169/52/20230761News from Media: URL: https://go.gale.com/ps/i.do id=GALE%7CA776548161&sid=sitemap&v=2.1&it=r&p=AONE&sw=w&userGroupName=anon%7E95eb4842&aty=open-web-entry

recommendations: Ryan B. “Bautista is an incredibly bright and skilled young man. He applied to the Executive Vice President's office for an intern position, but while conducting his interview it was evident that he was more than qualified to be leading a department. With his unselfish manner and clear passion for diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging, believing in him, we appointed Bautista to be an Executive Director of the Operations and Finance department as a freshman admit/first-year student. His leadership and vibrant personality cultivated a working environment that allowed his department to flourish and achieve great heights. Ops and Finance was undoubtedly the most productive department in the OEVP, and also one of the most productive throughout the entire ASUC during the Fall 2021 and Spring 2022 school year. His contributions to the office contributed to the OEVP demystifying the stigma behind first-year leadership in the ASUC. What Bautista was able to accomplish as a freshman student-executive director will probably never be replicated in the ASUC ever again. He is way ahead of so many not just in maturity, perspective, and leadership but also as an academic scholar and person. His appointment to this role is one of the decisions I will remember fondly when looking back at my time as ASUC OEVP Chief of Staff. It was an absolute pleasure to work with him.”

recommendations: Ilai A. “I had the privilege of bringing Bodhi on board as an intern during my time as Director of Business Intelligence at Boostability, where he was part of the financial modeling team. Despite being one of the youngest members in a cohort that included master’s and post-graduate students, Bodhi consistently stood out as a remarkable professional. His technical abilities and quantitative aptitude were exceptional, and he approached every task with efficiency, precision, and a kind demeanor. Bodhi’s hard-working and driven nature, coupled with his ability to adapt and excel in a challenging environment, made him an invaluable member of the team. I can confidently recommend Bodhi to any organization. He is a fantastic professional with immense potential, and I have no doubt he will continue to achieve great things in his career.”

Mishah Aryeh “I had the pleasure of working alongside Bodhi on the Financial Strategy team at Boostability and I can confidently vouch for the analytical rigor and critical thinking Bodhi offers. Bodhi played a key role in developing our pricing model, building out our financial forecasts, and streamlining the company's budgeting processes, demonstrating clear ability to analyze complex data and propose actionable strategies as part of a team. I highly recommend Bodhi to any team looking for a dedicated team player and a brilliant mind. Bodhi's contributions were invaluable to our success at Boostability over the summer, and I’m confident Bodhi will continue to excel in future endeavors.”

experience.title: Project Policy Analyst - Financial Aid and Scholarship Office, Fiscal Management and Compliance Unit
experience.description: • Managed federal, state, and institutional aid programs, ensuring adherence to regulations and compliance standards.• Conducted comprehensive training sessions and webinars for LAEP (Learning-Aligned Employment Program) and Work-Study Program, improving implementation and quality for both on-campus departments and off-campus employers.• Administered and validated over 3,000 Work-Study jobs for students for the 2023/24 academic year, optimizing placement and compliance with federal regulations.• Interpreted financial aid regulations and analyzed data to implement compliant procedures, ensuring timely financial aid delivery.•  Provided analytical support for project planning, implementation, monitoring, and evaluation of the Work-Study program, enhancing overall effectiveness of the Program at UC Berkeley.•  Led quality assurance initiatives by conducting surveys, analyzing feedback from departments and students about the Work-Study Program, and identifying areas for improvement.• Prepared ad-hoc reports and analyses to support external data requests and other unit functions and programs, including Work-Study contracts and documentation status for off-campus employers.• Managed reimbursements for off-campus Work-Study employers, ensuring accuracy and timely payments.• Supervised and guided office student workers, promoting their professional development and project success.• Reconciled financial aid data discrepancies, ensuring accurate subsidy distribution.
experience.description_html:
• Managed federal, state, and institutional aid programs, ensuring adherence to regulations and compliance standards.
• Conducted comprehensive training sessions and webinars for LAEP (Learning-Aligned Employment Program) and Work-Study Program, improving implementation and quality for both on-campus departments and off-campus employers.
• Administered and validated over 3,000 Work-Study jobs for students for the 2023/24 academic year, optimizing placement and compliance with federal regulations.
• Interpreted financial aid regulations and analyzed data to implement compliant procedures, ensuring timely financial aid delivery.
• Provided analytical support for project planning, implementation, monitoring, and evaluation of the Work-Study program, enhancing overall effectiveness of the Program at UC Berkeley.
• Led quality assurance initiatives by conducting surveys, analyzing feedback from departments and students about the Work-Study Program, and identifying areas for improvement.
• Prepared ad-hoc reports and analyses to support external data requests and other unit functions and programs, including Work-Study contracts and documentation status for off-campus employers.
• Managed reimbursements for off-campus Work-Study employers, ensuring accuracy and timely payments.
• Supervised and guided office student workers, promoting their professional development and project success.
• Reconciled financial aid data discrepancies, ensuring accurate subsidy distribution.

positions.subtitle: Caixa Econômica Federal
positions.description: • Led a team of 15 employees, developing and executing product sales strategies to achieve annual sales targets.• Managed a project in partnership with a major Brazilian residential construction company, coordinating a workforce of 6 to meet deadlines and deliverables. Resulted in the sale, financing, and delivery of 100+ apartments to families, increasing new client prospects, reaching $7.56 million in sales, and exceeding housing finance credit targets by 10.8%.• Ensured the housing finance project consistently met/exceeded targets, maintaining strong relationships with construction companies to secure ongoing contracts and a stable business pipeline.• Boosted revenue for all banking products through strategic business planning and account management, exceeding revenue targets in 2020 and 2021 by 118% and 101%, respectively.• Increased the agency's investment portfolio by 30% over 2 years, achieving 288% of investment fundraising goals in 2020 and 141% in 2021 through effective negotiations and customized client solutions.• Promoted to interim general manager, elevating one of the agencies managed from 4th to 2nd place among 10 agencies and achieving 121% of the annual target.• Developed collaborative relationships with key external partners, facilitating client prospecting and business growth, bringing in two new external partners to work with the team.• Participated in one of Brazil's largest social, digital, and financial inclusion projects, helping to integrate over 100 million digital/social savings accounts used for emergency aid and other benefits created during the COVID-19 pandemic, including many people into the banking system and distributing social benefits to 90+ million individuals with social vulnerability during the pandemic.
positions.title: Portfolio Manager / General Manager Interim
positions.description_html:
• Led a team of 15 employees, developing and executing product sales strategies to achieve annual sales targets.
• Managed a project in partnership with a major Brazilian residential construction company, coordinating a workforce of 6 to meet deadlines and deliverables. Resulted in the sale, financing, and delivery of 100+ apartments to families, increasing new client prospects, reaching $7.56 million in sales, and exceeding housing finance credit targets by 10.8%.
• Ensured the housing finance project consistently met/exceeded targets, maintaining strong relationships with construction companies to secure ongoing contracts and a stable business pipeline.
• Boosted revenue for all banking products through strategic business planning and account management, exceeding revenue targets in 2020 and 2021 by 118% and 101%, respectively.
• Increased the agency's investment portfolio by 30% over 2 years, achieving 288% of investment fundraising goals in 2020 and 141% in 2021 through effective negotiations and customized client solutions.
• Promoted to interim general manager, elevating one of the agencies managed from 4th to 2nd place among 10 agencies and achieving 121% of the annual target.
• Developed collaborative relationships with key external partners, facilitating client prospecting and business growth, bringing in two new external partners to work with the team.
• Participated in one of Brazil's largest social, digital, and financial inclusion projects, helping to integrate over 100 million digital/social savings accounts used for emergency aid and other benefits created during the COVID-19 pandemic, including many people into the banking system and distributing social benefits to 90+ million individuals with social vulnerability during the pandemic.

name: Rachael Abayomi FMVA®️ ACA
position: MBA Candidate University of California, Berkeley, Haas School of Business | Forte Fellow | Haas Finance Fellow | Haas International Student Representative
about:
I am an MBA student at UC Berkeley Haas, with over four years of experience in finance, including equity research, private banking, and business analysis. At Stanbic IBTC Bank, I created financial models and published research reports that helped client make decisive investment decisions. I also led strategies to grow client engagement and portfolio returns.

I’m passionate about technology and its role in shaping investment opportunities, building on my experience covering consumer sectors. Outside work, I founded the Dreams Girl Global Initiative to support education for underprivileged female children.

Let’s connect to share ideas on finance, tech, strategy, alternative investments and empowering future leaders!

volunteer_experience.info:
Flour Power strives to create a more inclusive society by, through the art of bakery and a broad range of workshops, providing practical training and employment opportunities to individuals with special needs. This unique model has not only helped individuals develop essential job skills, but also foster in them a sense of independence and self-confidence.This extraordinary experience has given me the opportunity to contribute to an organization that truly changes lives. Working alongside a…
            

    
    

    
        Show more

          
    
  
      

        
          Flour Power strives to create a more inclusive society by, through the art of bakery and a broad range of workshops, providing practical training and employment opportunities to individuals with special needs. This unique model has not only helped individuals develop essential job skills, but also foster in them a sense of independence and self-confidence.This extraordinary experience has given me the opportunity to contribute to an organization that truly changes lives. Working alongside a dedicated team, I feel deeply involved in activities that not only teach baking skills to individuals with special needs, but also fostered their independence. Each day at Flour Power is a new learning experience, reinforcing the impact of community-driven initiatives.

recommendations: Amanda Chernin Kass “I had the opportunity to work with Knoton while he was a Summer 2023 Analyst. Knoton demonstrated exceptional communication and research skills, making valuable contributions to our team. One of Knoton’s standout qualities is his dedication to thorough and insightful research. He approached every project with attention to detail, diving deep into data. His research was not only comprehensive but also thoughtfully analyzed. I have no doubt that Knoton has a bright future ahead.”

Stephen Monk “It was a privilege to work with Knoton when he was an analyst at my search fund, and I could not recommend him more highly. In addition to being diligent, thoughtful, and tenaciously detail-oriented, he brought a genuine enthusiasm that will benefit the culture of any organization lucky enough to hire him. Knoton is both intellectually curious and highly coachable, and he is proactive about developing his skillset. I look forward to watching Knoton’s finance career develop – I have no doubt he will be extremely successful.”

projects.title: Cache Replacement Simulator
projects.description: Simulates predictions of always taken, never taken, bimodal single bit, bimodal double bit, gshare, and tournament predictors, along with a branch target buffer simulator.

projects.title: Branch Predictor Simulator
projects.description: Simulates predictions of direct-mapped, set-associative, fully-associative, LRU fully-associative, hot-cold fully-associative, no allocation on write-miss set-associative, next-line prefetch set-associative, and prefetch on a miss set-associative caches.

projects.title: Set- Associative Cache Replacement Simulator
projects.description: Built read-only cache designed to simulate LRU, MRU, or random replacement methods based on user input in CBuilt simulation API and managed memory allocation using standard C libraries

projects.title: Large Hex Number Calculator
projects.description: - Created program in C that computed simple bitwise expressions of large hexadeicmal numbers inputted by the user in postfix format- Implemented data type that translated from postfix integers to binary numbers, computed expression, and translated back to data type- Built program and managed memory through standard C libraries

projects.title: Pippin CPU Emulator

volunteer_experience.info:
The XBG Association of Brotherhood creates a support system for young Black and Hispanic men who share in their bilingual language fluency, promoting success, good citizenship, improving life goals, developing community leaders and street, drug, and gang prevention.Growing up in New Orleans, having one of the highest poverty and crime rates in the nation, it is very easy to fall victim to “the streets.” Many of my friends were being raised in single parent homes with fathers in jail…
            

    
    

    
        Show more

          
    
  
      

        
          The XBG Association of Brotherhood creates a support system for young Black and Hispanic men who share in their bilingual language fluency, promoting success, good citizenship, improving life goals, developing community leaders and street, drug, and gang prevention.Growing up in New Orleans, having one of the highest poverty and crime rates in the nation, it is very easy to fall victim to “the streets.” Many of my friends were being raised in single parent homes with fathers in jail “in-the-hood” where staying alive and not getting into drugs, gangs or going to jail is extraordinarily hard. Because of these factors, I knew our duty had to be to keep each other “off-the-streets” and make sure that we grew up to be good citizens and successful young men with life goals that exceed those of our peers. In order to do this we host professional workshops, networking events, and tutoring for members. We believed that diversity was our strength and would lead to our success. I took it upon myself to invite other people in the city and around the country with like-minded goals in challenging situations. Since we began expanding, we now have members across Louisiana, Texas, and Florida. To bring all of our members together we participate in an annual retreat where we all go on a vacation during the summer to have a good time and share ideas. All of our members have successfully graduated from high school and are enrolled in 4 year universities, 75% being first generation college students and 50% being first generation high school graduates. XBG's mission is not over yet, XBG is a support system for life and we will continue to assist our members in every stage of their career.
            

    
    

    
        Show less

organizations.description: Hubba supports African American/Black students and other underrepresented groups with their business affiliated aspirations through professional exposure, professional development opportunities, and community involvement.As the Executive of Finance for the organization I managed the 70k+ budget as well as updated financial statements, sent invoices and W-9’s, and analyzed our sponsorship prices. HUBBA Host weekly internship as well as networking events for all HUBBA members. Every year one of our flagship events is the diversity career fair where we host an array of sponsors from different industries to provide recruitment opportunities for underrepresented students. This year the Diversity Career Fair, granted 100+ underrepresented students direct access to over 25 company recruiters from companies such as Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, Bain & Co., McKinsey & Co., Google, and Apple among others.

projects.title: NASA's Plant the Moon Challenge
projects.description: - Optimized the growth of rye by studying the effects of various additives to a potted soil mixture that includes 50% by volume lunar regolith simulant with my biology class- Personal roles: researched ideal plant and additive type, assisted in writing official experimental design, featured in ACL's pitch video

projects.title: Investigating Physical Reinforcement Designs to Prevent Breaks in Particle Boards
projects.description: Developed and tested the strength of five physical reinforcements applied to particle boards joined at a 90-degree angle using a pulley strength testing apparatus, hoping to prevent breakages in the low-cost wood manufacturing industry.

projects.title: Comparing the Biodiversity of Multiple Plots of Farmland After Secondary Succession Events Occurred in Different Years
projects.description: Using the Shannon-Wiener Diversity Index and a Kruskal-Wallis nonparametric test, I compared the biodiversity in 9 plots of land at Blandy Experimental Farm after artificial secondary succession events occurred in 2003, 2005, and 2009 using each year's corresponding dataset.

projects.title: Analyzing the Relationship between Radon Levels in Homes and their Proximity to Bodies of Water
projects.description: By using ArcGis mapping and conducting a 2 sample T-test, I analyzed the relationship between previously measured Radon levels in home basements and its proximity to bodies of water in Loudoun County.
